paragraphs.content: Psalm 51
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 51

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.

paragraphs.content: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

paragraphs.content: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

paragraphs.content: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.

paragraphs.content: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.

paragraphs.content: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.

paragraphs.content: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

paragraphs.content: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

paragraphs.content: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

paragraphs.content: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

paragraphs.content: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.

paragraphs.content: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

paragraphs.content: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.

paragraphs.content: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

paragraphs.content: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

paragraphs.content: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.

paragraphs.content: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

paragraphs.content: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

paragraphs.content: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
